name: NPR
text:
The Grammys are renaming four categories traditionally associated with artists of color — including changing “Best Urban Contemporary Album” to “Best Progressive R&B Album.” 
https://t.co/gwjda1SjVa

name: NPR
text:
Amazon will ban the use of its facial recognition technology by law enforcement agencies for one year amid pressure from police-reform advocates and civil rights groups.
https://t.co/xhJMbUnXaH

name: NPR
text:
Prosecutors in Sweden say a now-deceased graphic designer, Stig Engström, was likely the assassin who gunned down Prime Minister Olof Palme more than three decades ago on a Stockholm street.
https://t.co/gB4bnBV5uK

name: NPR
text:
Coachella and Stagecoach have both been canceled for 2020.
https://t.co/QxVXlRmueu

name: NPR
text:
Video captured by a reality TV production crew showing the death of Javier Ambler, a 40-year-old black man, while he was in police custody in Texas has reportedly been destroyed, according to local media.
https://t.co/mSM1s6nAjg

name: NPR
text:
UPDATE: The cable network A&E says it has canceled "Live PD."
https://t.co/nc7r2ZQScM

name: NPR
text: HBO Max has temporarily removed the 1939 film “Gone with the Wind” from its streaming service amid renewed criticism it romanticizes the Confederacy while glossing over the horrors of slavery. https://t.co/OJYcEyCuvX
